decks.notes: This deck focuses on using a mix of counterspells, removal spells, and card advantage to control the game and outvalue the opponent. The inclusion of Yorion as a companion allows for additional card advantage and flexibility. The deck runs a variety of threats and answers to handle a wide range of situations, with a strong emphasis on controlling the board and denying the opponent's resources. The mana base is designed to support the deck's color requirements and ensure smooth gameplay. Overall, the strategy revolves around controlling the game tempo and grinding out a win through incremental advantage.

This deck aims to achieve a fast-paced, aggressive playstyle by utilizing evasion, disruption, and mill strategies. By combining creatures like Thieves' Guild Enforcer and Soaring Thought-Thief with spells like Drown in the Loch and Heartless Act, the deck seeks to continuously apply pressure on the opponent while disrupting their plans. The inclusion of mill cards like Ruin Crab and Into the Story further adds to the disruptive element, with the potential to win through decking out the opponent. This deck thrives on tempo and controlling the pace of the game.

This deck focuses on quickly developing a board presence with efficient and powerful creatures like Bonecrusher Giant, Questing Beast, and Lovestruck Beast. The goal is to pressure the opponent early and often, dealing damage quickly and efficiently. Cards like Embercleave and The Great Henge provide additional power and resilience to outpace the opponent. With a mix of removal spells and card draw engines like Edgewall Innkeeper, this deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with aggression and card advantage.

The main concept of this deck is to control the game by utilizing removal spells, counter spells, and card advantage. The deck aims to outlast and outvalue the opponent by continuously generating card advantage through cards like Mazemind Tome and Omen of the Sea. The deck also includes a lot of board wipes like Shatter the Sky to clear the opponent's threats. The deck utilizes the companion Yorion, Sky Nomad for additional value and to flicker its creatures, gaining more card advantage. Overall, the deck focuses on efficient control elements and resource management to win the game.

The deck focuses on controlling the game through mill and removal spells, utilizing cards like Soaring Thought-Thief and Ruin Crab to mill the opponent's deck while using counterspells and removal spells like Drown in the Loch and Heartless Act to control the board. It relies on card advantage and disruption to outlast opponents and win through attrition. The inclusion of Lurrus of the Dream-Den as a companion adds an extra layer of recursion and value to the deck.

The main strategy of the deck is to control the board and outvalue the opponent by utilizing Yorion, Sky Nomad as a companion. The deck contains a mix of removal spells, counterspells, and value-generating permanents such as Skyclave Apparition and Elspeth Conquers Death. It also includes card draw and scrying effects to ensure consistency and maintain card advantage. The deck aims to stall the game with board wipes like Extinction Event and Doom Foretold, then overwhelm the opponent with a mass flicker effect from Yorion and Dance of the Manse for a strong late-game finish.

The deck focuses on quickly playing aggressive creatures like Questing Beast, Bonecrusher Giant, and Brushfire Elemental to deal damage to the opponent. It also includes cards like The Great Henge and Embercleave to further enhance the power of these creatures. The deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a combination of strong creatures and powerful spells to control the battlefield and secure a fast victory.

The main concept of this deck is to flood the board with small white creatures and pump them up with cards like Heliod, Sun-Crowned and Maul of the Skyclaves to quickly overwhelm the opponent. The deck focuses on aggressive plays and protecting its creatures with cards like Selfless Savior and Alseid of Life's Bounty. The inclusion of Lurrus of the Dream-Den allows for recursion of important cards, while Elspeth, Sun's Nemesis provides additional value and finishing power. The overall strategy is to maintain a strong board presence and apply constant pressure on the opponent.

The concept of this deck is to control the game through card advantage, disruption, and removal spells before closing out the game with powerful threats. By using a combination of counter spells, removal spells, and card draw engines like Mazemind Tome and Omen of the Sea, the deck aims to outvalue the opponent and grind them out of resources. The deck also utilizes powerful finishers like Ugin, the Spirit Dragon and Shark Typhoon to seal the deal once the opponent's resources have been exhausted.

The main concept of this deck is to use various control elements to disrupt the opponent's strategy while simultaneously milling their deck with cards like Ruin Crab and Merfolk Windrobber. Thieves' Guild Enforcer, Soaring Thought-Thief, and Into the Story provide additional mill and graveyard interaction, while cards like Drown in the Loch and Heartless Act offer removal options. Lurrus of the Dream-Den serves as a companion to provide additional value through recurring small creatures. The deck aims to maintain board control and capitalize on milling the opponent's deck as win condition.

The deck focuses on controlling the opponent's board through a combination of mill effects and removal spells. By continually milling the opponent's deck with cards like Ruin Crab and Merfolk Windrobber, while utilizing counter spells like Mystical Dispute and Into the Roil, the deck aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan and win through card advantage with Into the Story. Lurrus of the Dream-Den provides additional value by allowing you to recast key cards from your graveyard. Overall, the deck aims to outlast opponents through attrition and resource management.

The main idea of this deck is to quickly build a board presence with cheap creatures like Thieves' Guild Enforcer and Merfolk Windrobber, while disrupting the opponent's strategy with cards like Drown in the Loch and Heartless Act. The deck aims to fuel card advantage with spells like Into the Story and Of One Mind, while using Zareth San, the Trickster as a finisher to close out the game. The mana base is focused on ensuring a smooth curve and enabling spells like Agadeem's Awakening for late-game power plays.

The main strategy of this Gruul Aggro deck is to quickly establish a board presence with efficient creatures like Questing Beast and Brushfire Elemental. The deck aims to apply pressure to the opponent early on with aggressive creatures and combat tricks, such as Embercleave and Primal Might, to deal massive damage. The deck also benefits from card draw and mana ramp provided by cards like Edgewall Innkeeper and The Great Henge. The land base is designed to ensure consistent mana production for the aggressive game plan.

The main focus of this deck is to put pressure on the opponent early and maintain that pressure throughout the game. With a lineup of efficient creatures like Questing Beast and Brushfire Elemental, along with powerful spells like Embercleave and The Great Henge, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with aggressive plays. The deck also includes cards like Scavenging Ooze and Lovestruck Beast for additional versatility and resilience. The mana base is optimized for consistent access to the deck's resources, allowing for a smooth and aggressive gameplay experience.

The main idea of this deck is to control the board and disrupt your opponent's strategy while gradually building up your own resources. This is achieved through a combination of high-value creatures like Terror of the Peaks and Lovestruck Beast, as well as powerful spells like Genesis Ultimatum and Cultivate to ramp up your mana. The inclusion of Obosh as a companion adds extra pressure and makes your damage output more efficient. Overall, the deck aims to outvalue and outlast your opponent in order to secure victory.

This deck focuses on quickly deploying small, efficient creatures to overwhelm the opponent with early aggression. By utilizing low-cost creatures like Selfless Savior and Skyclave Apparition, along with pump effects like Luminarch Aspirant and Maul of the Skyclaves, the deck aims to pressure the opponent and maintain board presence. Additionally, cards like Hushbringer and Giant Killer provide disruptive elements to control the opponent's game plan. The inclusion of Castle Ardenvale and Kabira Takedown adds versatility to the deck's game plan, allowing for different strategies depending on the matchup.
